items.title: Listed startups get a delivery of reality: It's hot on the Street
items.description: The tide is expected to turn for some of the companies including Swiggy and Mobkwik over the next few quarters. ETIG offers a snapshot of key takeaways from the recently concluded results season for each of these startups.

items.title: Buffett's Berkshire posts record profit on insurance, investments
items.description: Operating profit surged 27% to $47.44 billion in 2024, up from $37.35 billion in the previous year. The fourth quarter set a record, with operating profit soaring 71% to $14.53 billion ($1,010 per Class A share), driven by strong insurance gains and foreign currency benefits, compared to $8.48 billion a year earlier.

items.title: StanC profit before tax takes a hit on higher provisions
items.description: Standard Chartered Bank reported a modest 3% increase in profit before tax in India for 2024, driven by higher fee and trading income despite a decline in net interest income. However, a surge in provision costs significantly impacted profit growth, and the bank's India loan book shrank slightly.

items.title: Provision rise drags down StanC 2024 India profit
items.description: Standard Chartered's India profit before tax rose just 3% to $308 million in 2024, impacted by a 1.5x rise in provisions. Despite a 10% operating income increase, net interest income declined, while trading and fee income helped offset losses.

items.title: Alibaba Q3 Results: Co beats revenue estimates on strong year-end shopping sales
items.description: China's Alibaba Group Holding on Wednesday topped Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue, on strong year-end shopping sales and the success of its strategy to attract cost-conscious consumers.

items.title: Bharti Telecom's Q3FY25 net loss widened due to higher finance costs linked to Airtel share buys: Singtel
items.description: Singapore Telecommunications: Bharti Telecom’s net loss widened in Q3 FY25 due to higher finance costs from additional borrowings to acquire more Airtel shares. Singapore-based Singtel, which owns 49.44% of Bharti Telecom, reported a negative pre-tax contribution from the company. Singtel’s overall net profit rose 22%, driven by stronger contributions from Bharti Airtel and Airtel Africa.
